subtitle.Text: Fan zines, I mean, that’s one of the things that we started doing right away, was doing these riot grrrl fan zines and everyone would contribute and write, you know, an article for it,
and we’d compile it and make these riot grrrl fan zines and we would mail them out to people. I mean, y’know all this is so funny to talk about it before the internet,

but you know we used the mail and people would write, you know we had a P.O. box and we started getting letters because people would read someone else’s fan zine there’s this riot grrrl thing that started happening, right,
and it just, I mean, it was the most incredible thing it just snowballed. It just, people just, girls wanted to be a part of it, immediately, across the country.

So from the time we started Heavens to Betsy in 1991 I think it was only a year later, right, so one year of riot grrrl meetings and these letters happening and these fan zines happening, well a year later we left on the Riot Grrrl Tour,

the Heavens to Betsy/Bratmobile Riot Grrrl Tour from Olympia to DC. Well… For some reason it took us like almost five weeks to get there on this tour, and we ended up staying in DC another... something like five weeks before the Riot Grrrl Convention that happened.

So that all this, you know, all these fan zines all these girls across the country starting getting interested in riot grrrl and the press just went bananas. I mean, the press attention was off the hook. New York Times, USA Today,

all these journalists wanted information and wanted to interview all of us, and it was just… yeah, it was crazy. So by the time we got to the riot grrrl convention, suddenly we were truly part of a movement.
